name: CVE-2012-1713
description: Unspecified vulnerability in the Java Runtime Environment (JRE) component in Oracle Java SE 7 update 4 and earlier, 6 update 32 and earlier, 5 update 35 and earlier, 1.4.2_37 and earlier, and JavaFX 2.1 and earlier allows remote attackers to affect confidentiality, integrity, and availability via unknown vectors related to 2D.
pattern: [(software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:oracle:jre:*:update4:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:oracle:jdk:*:update4:*:*:*:*:*:*') OR (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:oracle:jdk:*:update32:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:oracle:jre:*:update32:*:*:*:*:*:*') OR (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:sun:jdk:*:update35:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:sun:jre:*:update35:*:*:*:*:*:*') OR (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:sun:jdk:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:sun:jre:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*') OR (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:oracle:javafx:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*')]

external_references.description: This object was created using cve2stix from the Signals Corps.
